opportunity_name: L'Oréal-UNESCO For Women in Science International Awards
field_of_study: Life Sciences OR Physical Sciences OR Mathematics
work_experience_minimum: Not specified - must have significant research record
application_process: Nomination by scientific academy or equivalent body
required_documents: Nomination form, CV, publication list, research statement, 3 reference letters
selection_criteria: Outstanding scientific achievement + impact on knowledge + leadership in field + gender equality advocacy
notes: EUR 100k prize per laureate; 5 laureates annually (Africa/Arab States/Asia-Pacific/Europe/Latin America); 27 years history; Nobel-level prestige; women in science

opportunity_name: OWSD-Elsevier Foundation Awards for Early Career Women Scientists
institution_name: Organisation for Women in Science for the Developing World - Elsevier Foundation
nationality_eligibility: Women scientists from developing countries only
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of developing country
residency_requirements: Must be working in developing country
field_of_study: Sustainable energy OR water OR food security (STEM focus)
stipend_amount: 5000 USD total prize + travel to award ceremony
required_documents: Application form, CV, PhD certificate, publication list, research statement, 2 reference letters, institutional support letter
selection_criteria: Scientific achievement + research quality + impact on sustainable development + women's empowerment
mobility_requirements: Must be based in developing country
notes: USD 5k prize + trip to award ceremony; 5 laureates annually; focus on sustainable development (energy/water/food); women from Global South only

institution_name: Organisation for Women in Science for the Developing World
country: Developing countries (must work at home institution)
nationality_eligibility: Women scientists from developing countries only
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of developing country
residency_requirements: Must be employed at institution in developing country
career_stage: Early-career researcher (within 5 years of PhD completion)
stipend_amount: Up to 50000 USD total over 2 years for research
required_documents: Application form, CV, PhD certificate, research proposal, budget, publication list, 2 reference letters, institutional support letter
selection_criteria: Research quality + feasibility + impact on home country + leadership potential + women's empowerment
mobility_requirements: Must conduct research at home institution in developing country
notes: Up to USD 50k over 2 years; research support for postdocs; must work at home institution; STEM fields; women from developing countries; leadership training included

opportunity_name: Schlumberger Foundation Faculty for the Future Fellowship
african_countries_eligible: All African countries eligible (check eligibility list)
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of developing or emerging economy
stipend_amount: Varies by location and program (typically ~30-50k USD per year)
required_documents: Application form, CV, academic transcripts, research proposal, admission letter (or applied proof), 3 reference letters (deadline Nov 14), STEM outreach evidence
selection_criteria: Academic excellence + leadership potential + STEM outreach + gender equality commitment + return home intention
mobility_requirements: Can study anywhere (typically at top universities globally)
notes: ~50 fellowships/year; 965+ Fellows from 95 countries since 2004; USD 30-50k/year typical support; women in STEM; developing/emerging economies; return home encouraged

institution_name: Royal Society - African Academy of Sciences
african_countries_eligible: Sub-Saharan Africa countries only (check AAS list)
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of sub-Saharan African country
residency_requirements: Must conduct research at sub-Saharan African institution
stipend_amount: Up to 150000 GBP per year for 2 years (total 300k GBP)
application_process: Online application via Royal Society portal
required_documents: Application form, CV, research proposal, publication list, host institution letter, 3 reference letters, budget justification
selection_criteria: Research excellence + independence potential + leadership + impact on Africa + institutional support
mobility_requirements: Must be based in sub-Saharan Africa
renewable: Renewable for second 2-year term (total 4 years possible)
notes: GBP 150k/year × 2 years (GBP 300k total); renewable for 2nd term (GBP 600k total over 4 years); sub-Saharan Africa only; independent research; leadership development

institution_name: The World Academy of Sciences - German Research Foundation
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of sub-Saharan African country
residency_requirements: Must be based in sub-Saharan Africa
required_documents: Application form, CV, research proposal (up to 5 pages), invitation letter from German host, recommendation letter from home institution head, 2 additional references
selection_criteria: Research collaboration potential + scientific merit + capacity building + benefit to Africa + host support
mobility_requirements: 3-month visit to Germany; must return to Africa
notes: 3-month research visit to Germany; sub-Saharan Africa postdocs; EUR 3k/month subsistence; initiates long-term collaboration; must return to Africa

field_of_study: STEM fields OR social sciences (interdisciplinary pivot required)
stipend_amount: ~100000 USD per year stipend + research costs
required_documents: Nomination form (by institution), full application (CV, research plan, transcripts, 3 references, interdisciplinary pivot proposal)
selection_criteria: Academic excellence + interdisciplinary potential + leadership + societal impact + pivot feasibility
mobility_requirements: Can work anywhere globally (typically top research institutions)
data_source: Official Schmidt Science Fellows website verified 2026-02-13
notes: USD 100k/year; ~30 Fellows/year; interdisciplinary pivot required; PhD completed May 2026-June 2027; global network; leadership training; extremely prestigious

nationality_eligibility: African Union member states + African diaspora
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of African Union member state OR African diaspora
residency_requirements: No restrictions - study at PAU campuses across Africa
age_limit: Under 28 for male OR under 30 for female (Master's) OR under 35 (PhD)
language_requirements: English OR French OR Arabic (depends on campus)
application_process: Online application via African Union portal
required_documents: Application form, CV, academic transcripts, recommendation letters (2), research proposal (PhD), motivation letter
selection_criteria: Academic excellence + research potential + Africa development commitment + leadership
mobility_requirements: Must study at PAU campus (Kenya/Nigeria/Cameroon/Algeria/South Africa)
notes: Full scholarship (tuition + stipend + accommodation); 5 PAU institutes across Africa; African Union member states + diaspora; age limits apply; Pan-African focus

opportunity_name: Mandela Washington Fellowship for Young African Leaders
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of sub-Saharan African country
residency_requirements: Must be living and working in sub-Saharan Africa
application_process: Online application via U.S. State Department portal
required_documents: Application form, CV, essays, professional references, English proficiency proof, leadership examples
selection_criteria: Leadership potential + professional accomplishment + civic engagement + English proficiency + U.S. commitment
mobility_requirements: 6 weeks in U.S. at host university; must return to Africa
data_source: Official Mandela Washington Fellowship website verified 2026-02-13
notes: NOTE: Fellowship will NOT take place in 2026 (confirmed on official website); ~700 fellows when active; 6-week leadership program; sub-Saharan Africa 25-35 years; YALI network

citizenship_requirements: No restrictions - must be enrolled in accredited university
residency_requirements: Must be enrolled at accredited PhD program
tuition_coverage: 70000 USD per year cost of education allowance
stipend_amount: Not a separate stipend (70k education allowance covers stipend)
application_process: Institutional nomination required (limited slots per university)
required_documents: Nomination by university, CV, research statement, publication list, 3 reference letters, academic transcripts
selection_criteria: Research excellence + innovation potential + publication record + Google research alignment
mobility_requirements: Must be enrolled in PhD program (any location)
notes: USD 70k/year education allowance × 2 years; ~50 Fellows globally; computer science focus; Google Research mentorship; institutional nomination required

field_of_study: Computer Science OR related fields (varies by challenge)
career_stage: PhD student OR postdoc OR faculty
stipend_amount: Research funding varies by challenge (typically 50-200k USD total)
application_process: Direct online application via Microsoft Research portal
required_documents: Proposal (varies by challenge), CV, research plan, budget, institutional support letter, 2 references (PhD students)
selection_criteria: Research quality + innovation + alignment with Microsoft challenges + collaboration potential + feasibility
notes: Research funding varies by challenge; collaboration with Microsoft Research; open to faculty/PhD/postdocs; specific research challenges; publication focus

african_countries_eligible: All African countries eligible (check developing countries list)
citizenship_requirements: Must be citizen of developing country
stipend_amount: Monthly stipend + research costs (~30000 EUR total per year)
application_process: Online application via Humboldt Foundation portal
required_documents: Application form, CV, research proposal, publication list, 2 reference letters, host institution support, climate action plan
selection_criteria: Climate relevance + scientific quality + practical impact + networking potential + return home commitment
mobility_requirements: 12 months in Germany; must return home
research_requirements: Yes - climate research or practice project
publication_requirements: Yes - publication or practice output expected
notes: EUR 30k/year; up to 20 Fellows/year; climate focus; 12 months in Germany; developing countries only; scientists + practitioners; return home commitment

nationality_eligibility: Citizens of low- and middle-income countries
african_countries_eligible: All African low- and middle-income countries eligible
stipend_amount: Up to 250000 GBP total over 5 years for research
required_documents: Application form, CV, research proposal, budget, publication list, 3 reference letters, institutional support
selection_criteria: Research quality + innovation + feasibility + health impact in LMIC + training plan + independence
notes: Up to GBP 250k over 5 years; biomedical/health research; LMICs only; independent research; career development; Wellcome network access

stipend_amount: Travel + accommodation for TED events covered
required_documents: Application form, video introduction, work portfolio, references, innovation statement
selection_criteria: Innovation + impact + potential + communication + TED values alignment
notes: ~20 Fellows/cohort; 500+ alumni network; TED platform access; multi-year engagement; all fields; global visibility; extremely prestigious

language_requirements: English OR French OR Spanish OR Portuguese
work_experience_minimum: Not specified - must have established initiative with demonstrated impact
stipend_amount: Tailored stipend up to 3 years (if needed)
required_documents: Application form, venture description, impact evidence, personal story, references
selection_criteria: Social impact + innovation + entrepreneurial quality + ethical fiber + potential for systems change
mobility_requirements: Flexible - continue work in home country
renewable: Stipend up to 3 years; lifetime Ashoka Fellow status
notes: Stipend up to 3 years if needed; 3800+ Fellows in 90+ countries; lifetime fellowship; social entrepreneurship; systems change focus; global network; highly selective
